reference.title: File Creation Commands
reference.shortdesc: Commands for creating new DITA topics, maps, and bookmaps.

section.title: DITA: Create New Topic
section.p: Creates a new DITA topic file with proper DOCTYPE and structure.

dlentry.dd: For conceptual information that helps users understand a subject. Uses <concept> root element with <conbody>.
For procedural information with step-by-step instructions. Uses <task> root element with <taskbody> and <steps>.
For reference information like API documentation or command syntax. Uses <reference> root element with <refbody>.
Generic topic type for content that doesn't fit other categories. Uses <topic> root element with <body>.

ol.li: Run the command from Command Palette
The file is created in the current folder with .dita extension

section.title: DITA: Create New Map
section.p: Creates a new DITA map file for organizing topics.
section.codeblock: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE map PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Map//EN" "map.dtd"> <map id="my-map"> <title>My Map Title</title> <topicref href="topic1.dita"/> <topicref href="topic2.dita"/> </map>

ol.li: Run the command from Command Palette
The file is created with .ditamap extension

section.p: After creation, add <topicref> elements to reference your topics.

section.title: DITA: Create New Bookmap
section.p: Creates a new bookmap for book-oriented publications.
section.codeblock: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE bookmap PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA BookMap//EN" "bookmap.dtd"> <bookmap id="my-bookmap"> <booktitle> <mainbooktitle>My Book Title</mainbooktitle> </booktitle> <frontmatter> <booklists><toc/></booklists> </frontmatter> <chapter href="chapter1.dita"/> <backmatter> <booklists><indexlist/></booklists> </backmatter> </bookmap>

ul.li: Use lowercase letters and hyphens (e.g., getting-started.dita)
Use descriptive names that reflect content
